result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Allan N Conard Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Allan N Conard Jr
parties.address: 485 Cottage Grove Ave, Green Bay, WI 54304

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

miscConds.notes: Pay $2100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact with his child if he's been drinking. Not to operate a motor vehicle with his child in vehicle. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.
Submit DNA sample. Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 10/8/15.

timeConds.notes:
Good time and Huber privileges granted.

9/2/15 10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 10/8/15, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Allan N Conard in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Allan N Conard in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Defendant agrees with prior convictions. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
